citations.narrative:
The acquisition record for 2 adult ringtails was not available for review. The acquisition record dated 02 June 2025 for a
juvenile opossum "Sharon" is incomplete and does not have the name and address of the individual donating the animal.
Failure to record required information in acquisition records of regulated animals inhibits APHIS Officials' duties to trace
animal movement and assess compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain
records which fully and correctly disclose information required in CFR sections 2.75 (b)(1)(i-vii) in the acquisition and
disposition of animals other than dogs and cats.
Correct by 27 July 2025.

The facility's contingency plan last review is dated 03/13/2024. An annual review has not been documented since that
time. It has been more than a year since the last review. Failure to annually review the contingency plan for the humane
care of animals during emergencies may result in the plan becoming out of date or obsolete. Each licensee must maintain
documentation of their annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made to their plan since the
previous year's review.
Correct by 27 July 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The acquisition record for 2 adult ringtails was not available for review. The acquisition record dated 02 June 2025 for a 
juvenile opossum "Sharon" is incomplete and does not have the name and address of the individual donating the animal. 
Failure to record required information in acquisition records of regulated animals inhibits APHIS Officials' duties to trace 
animal movement and assess compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain 
records which fully and correctly disclose information required in CFR sections 2.75 (b)(1)(i-vii) in the acquisition and 
disposition of animals other than dogs and cats. 
 
Correct by 27 July 2025. 
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility's contingency plan last review is dated 03/13/2024. An annual review has not been documented since that 
time. It has been more than a year since the last review. Failure to annually review the contingency plan for the humane 
care of animals during emergencies may result in the plan becoming out of date or obsolete. Each licensee must maintain 
documentation of their annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made to their plan since the 
previous year's review. 
 
Correct by 27 July 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
